result.execSummary:
The defendant Trent Y Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under Wis. Stat. 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation and all conditions.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Follow all recommendations of treatment providers including taking of prescribed medications. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of DOC.

timeConds.notes: To perform 50 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

Defendant Trent Y Robinson in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Trent Y Robinson in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 11:30 am.
No violent contact with T.B.    To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Take prescribed medications at time and in amounts directed by prescription.

Defendant Trent Y Robinson appears by video conference along with attorney Eric Steven Maciolek who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 6/20/16 at 10:00 am.
